Message.Msg: Jim Rogers Blasts "This Is Going To End Badly... And The Rest Of The World Knows It" The only thing exceptional about the USA is "its the largest debtor nation in the history of the world" is how Jim Rogers begins this brief interview with RT and he doesnt back away from the rhetoric. The sad truth, he notes, is that the US "has been kicking the can down the road for years..." how do you think we got so much debt, he chides. "Every year that goes by we go deeper and deeper into debt," adding, rather ominously, that it "will be solved one way or another." They will kick the can once more; then next week, we will be told that the problem is fixed and compromise is here. However, Rogers warns, eventually the market is going to turn away; "this is going to end badly... and the rest of the world knows it."

Message.Title: IBM miss is AMZN win
Message.Msg: the near $1.0B Revenue miss at IBM -- how much did AMZN take? we shall see soon. Don't forget this press release last week. "A Federal judge ruled in favor of Amazon Web Services in its bid to hold onto the CIA cloud contract it won over IBM." and don't forget earlier this summer... we heard, Another day brings another wisp of data highlighting the difference in revenue between Amazon Web Services and the other megaclouds. this time the data is courtesy of analyst firm the Synergy Research Group, which says that for the second quarter of 2013, global infrastructure-as-a-service and platform-as-a-service revenues accounted for some $2.25bn in revenue, with Amazon taking a whopping 28 percent of all market share (3x IBM's share)

Topic.Title: Digitime: Amazon to resell HTC phones at loss

Message.Msg: "Going to be a rough ride for the longs who don't realize this has only been a trading scam." i could have copied and pasted this statement from your 2012 notes starting in July 2012 after you came here from CMG strike. I warned you then, and warn you again: it hasn't nothing to do with AMZN as a trading scam: it has to do with the easy QE money given to the banks/WS players,as we have competitive devaluations in the G7 countries going on around the world. It's devaluing money and purchasing power, and sending stocks like AMZN to the moon. Do you see that not continuing? Do you see how much the Fed is gonna have to support increased debt ceiling Obama spending going foward? This isnt' even close to ending. If you want to see a microcosm of wha's really going on, look at the Venezuelen stock market as they kill their purchasing power, in that scenario , stocks go up , and up big. You're warnings are now so beyond crying wolf it's not even funny anymore.

Topic.Title: Digitime: Amazon to resell HTC phones at loss

Message.Msg: That same money printing has caused Amazon's earnings to tank. It consumed its excess cash/working capital and has already had to take on $3B in LT debt to keep the scam running, but there's no fuel left. Gravity brings everything down to earth, unless something achieves escape velocity. Amazon has played a very dangerous game trying to achieve escape velocity... It just didn't have enough fuel so it already had to refuel in-flight once. Refueling gets more dangerous as it gets higher... The institutions that try to refuel this time will be putting themselves at risk...
